C3S_434_002.IndexTitle: Climatic suitability for the tiger mosquito - season length
C3S_434_002.ExplorePresentation: The map shows a 30-year average of the season length of the climatic suitability for the tiger mosquito for the chosen scenario plotted as area means for each region.
C3S_434_002.NUTS_a: The EUROSTAT NUTS classification ([Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/background)) is a hierarchical system for dividing up the economic territory of Europe. The size of the regions shown on the map can be adjusted by selecting the appropriate NUTS level: national level (NUTS-0), first sub-national level (NUTS-1), second sub-national level (NUTS-2), and third sub-national level (NUTS-3).
C3S_434_002.NUTSActions: The regions on the map facilitate dynamic access to the underlying data. Hover the mouse pointer over a region to view the value of the area mean or click on a region to request a time series plot.  Likewise, the trans-national average for the EEA member and cooperating countries (EEA 38) can be accessed via the "Europe" bounding box.
C3S_434_002.PopUpPlot_1: The time series plot shows the ensemble mean and standard deviation (SD) of the season length of the climatic suitability responses for the tiger mosquito to the chosen scenario conditions across the EURO-CORDEX regional climate model ensemble.
C3S_434_002.PopUpPlot_2: The values represent the centres of a 30-year running average from 1971 to 2100 which results in a time series covering the period from 1986 to 2085.
C3S_434_002.PopUpActions: Click and hover the mouse over the time series plot to view the data values and to reveal action buttons for features such as “zoom” and “download plot as a png”.
C3S_434_002.PUActionsShort: Hover over the time series to display the values and the action buttons.
C3S_434_002.PopUpTitle: The season length of the climatic suitability for the tiger mosquito in <NUTS> under <Scenario>.
C3S_434_002.PopUpSubtitle: Values represent a 30-year running average of the EURO-CORDEX ensemble mean and ensemble standard deviation (SD).

C3S_434_004.ExplorePresentation: The annual mean fire weather index for each year from 1979 to 2019 is plotted on a map showing the European NUTS aggregation regions.
C3S_434_004.NUTS_a: The EUROSTAT NUTS classification ([Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/background)) is a hierarchical system for dividing up the economic territory of Europe. The size of the regions shown on the map can be adjusted by selecting the appropriate NUTS level: national level (NUTS-0), first sub-national level (NUTS-1), and second sub-national level (NUTS-2).
C3S_434_004.NUTSActions: The regions on the map facilitate dynamic access to the underlying data. Hover the mouse pointer over a region to view its name or click on a region to request a time series plot. Likewise, the trans-national average for the EEA member and cooperating countries (EEA 38) can be accessed via the "Europe" bounding box.
C3S_434_004.PopUpPlot_1: The time series plot shows the area mean fire weather index for the chosen region for each month of the chosen year.
C3S_434_004.PopUpActions: Click and hover the mouse over the time series plot to view the data values and to reveal action buttons for features such as “zoom” and “download plot as a png”.
C3S_434_004.PUActionsShort: Hover over the time series to display the values and the action buttons.

C3S_434_009.IndexTitle: Projected change in Biologically Effective Degree Days
C3S_434_009.ExplorePresentation: the projected change of the monthly and annual biologically effective degree days for the chosen scenario and time period are plotted as area means for each region.
C3S_434_009.NUTS_a: The EUROSTAT NUTS classification ([Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/background)) is a hierarchical system for dividing up the economic territory of Europe. The size of the regions shown on the map can be adjusted by selecting the appropriate NUTS level: national level (NUTS-0), first sub-national level (NUTS-1), second sub-national level (NUTS-2), and third sub-national level (NUTS-3).
C3S_434_009.NUTSActions: The regions on the map facilitate dynamic access to the underlying data. Hover the mouse pointer over a region to view the value of the area mean or click on a region to request a time series plot.  Likewise, the trans-national average for the EEA member and cooperating countries (EEA 38) can be accessed via the "Europe" bounding box.
C3S_434_009.PopUpPlot_1: The time series plot shows the ensemble mean and range of biologically effective degree day responses to the chosen scenario conditions across an ensemble of five CMIP5 climate models.
C3S_434_009.PopUpActions: Click and hover the mouse over the time series plot to view the data values and to reveal action buttons for features such as “zoom” and “download plot as a png”.
C3S_434_009.PUActionsShort: Hover over the time series to display the values and the action buttons.
C3S_434_009.IfAnomaly_1: This index is expressed as a change relative to a reference period so the (1981-2010) ERA5 reference climatology is also provided.
C3S_434_009.IfAnomaly_2: The reference climate contains the mean climatology, the standard deviation from the mean, and the 5th and 95th percentiles.
C3S_434_009.PopUpTitle: The projected change in the <anomaly period> biologically effective degree days in <NUTS> under <scenario> for <time period>.
C3S_434_009.PopUpSubtitle: Showing the ensemble mean, ensemble maximum and ensemble minimum across 5 CMIP5 climate models.
C3S_434_009.ClimTitle: Climatology statistics for the monthly mean biologically effective degree days for the period 1981-2010.
C3S_434_009.ClimSubtitle: Based on ERA5 reanalysis data and showing the mean, standard deviation, and 5th and 95th percentiles of the climatology.

C3S_434_016.PopUpPlot_1: The time series plot shows the ensemble mean and standard deviation (SD) of health-related heat wave responses to the chosen scenario conditions across the EURO-CORDEX regional climate model ensemble.
C3S_434_016.PopUpPlot_2: The values represent the centres of a 30-year running average from 1971 to 2100 which results in a time series covering the period from 1986 to 2085.
C3S_434_016.PopUpActions: Click and hover the mouse over the time series plot to view the data values and to reveal action buttons for features such as “zoom” and “download plot as a png”.
C3S_434_016.PUActionsShort: Hover over the time series to display the values and the action buttons.
C3S_434_016.PopUpTitle: The number of health-related heat wave days in <NUTS> under <scenario>.
C3S_434_016.PopUpSubtitle: Values represent a 30-year running average of the EURO-CORDEX ensemble mean and ensemble standard deviation (SD).

C3S_434_017.ExplorePresentation: The map shows the 30-year average of the number of climatological heatwave days for the chosen time period and scenario plotted as area means for each region.
C3S_434_017.NUTS_a: The EUROSTAT NUTS classification ([Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics](https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/background)) is a hierarchical system for dividing up the economic territory of Europe. The size of the regions shown on the map can be adjusted by selecting the appropriate NUTS level: national level (NUTS-0), first sub-national level (NUTS-1), second sub-national level (NUTS-2), and third sub-national level (NUTS-3).
C3S_434_017.NUTSActions: The regions on the map facilitate dynamic access to the underlying data. Hover the mouse pointer over a region to view the value of the area mean or click on a region to request a time series plot.  Likewise, the trans-national average for the EEA member and cooperating countries (EEA 38) can be accessed via the "Europe" bounding box.
C3S_434_017.PopUpPlot_1: The time series plot shows the ensemble mean and standard deviation (SD) of climatological heat wave responses to the chosen scenario conditions across the EURO-CORDEX regional climate model ensemble.
C3S_434_017.PopUpPlot_2: The values represent the centres of a 30-year running average from 1971 to 2100 which results in a time series covering the period from 1986 to 2085.
C3S_434_017.PopUpActions: Click and hover the mouse over the time series plot to view the data values and to reveal action buttons for features such as “zoom” and “download plot as a png”.
C3S_434_017.PUActionsShort: Hover over the time series to display the values and the action buttons.
C3S_434_017.PopUpTitle: The number of climatological heat wave days in <NUTS> under <scenario>.
C3S_434_017.PopUpSubtitle: Values represent a 30-year running average of the EURO-CORDEX ensemble mean and ensemble standard deviation (SD).
